col_2.label: WHAT IS SPADE?
col_2.heading: Spade is a two-sided marketplace that matches storage clients to storage providers
col_2.description: Storage clients, also known as tenants, can specify how they’d like their data to be onboarded. Compliant storage providers drive deal making processes to ensure the data is onboarded efficiently.

col_1.text: The Spade platform allows you to specify a unique storage policy, ensuring that storage providers you work with meet your requirements

col_1.label: HOW DOES SPADE ONBOARD DATA FAST?
col_1.heading: Spade automates key parts of data storage supply and demand processes
col_1.description: Any storage provider on Filecoin can be part of Spade, as long as they adhere to a certain baseline of network-wide norms, and can disclose certain basic information, like organizational affiliation and datacenter locations

col_1.heading: Spade gives tenants highly tunable options for how their data is onboarded to Filecoin.

card.heading: Tenant organizes their data into collections
card.description: The tenant places data  into discrete groups called collections, which will later be used for deal-making

card.heading: Tenant sets a policy for what kind of storage providers they would like
card.description: This may include factors such as replication requirements and geographic distribution of data (geofencing)

card.heading: Spade broker matches SPs to this tenant
card.description: Spade finds storage provider partners deemed eligible based on the client’s needs, including location, size, reputation and historic quality of service

card.heading: Spade broker creates suitable deals based on policy and matching SPs
card.description: The rest is automated Spade makes the deals, decreasing overhead for both the client and for storage providers — everyone wins!

col_2.label: CONFIGURABLE POLICY
col_2.heading: As a storage client, or tenant, on Spade, you'll have access to a variety of configuration options that govern how and where your data is stored.
col_2.description:
Spade operates in an automated way thanks to settings that tenants can set, which affect where data is stored, and for how long.

As a tenant, you'll be able to set a global policy, enabling you to control where your data is stored, what kind of SPs you'll be working with, and how much redundancy, or replication, a particular collection of files should have.

cards.title: Broker API
cards.description: The core deal engine API the SPs interact with. They ping it to see the list of piece CIDs they are eligible to store, from clients that they have signed up to service. They can then elect to be sent deal proposals from the list. Each CID is paired with a URL from the client to get to the CAR file or an SP is expected to retrieve it from the network.

cards.title: SP KYB service
cards.description: A set of processes to perform due diligence on the location and other metadata supplied by an SP.

cards.title: Remote deal-proposal signing agent and relay network
cards.description: Allows tenants to complete deal proposal signing without ever exposing their keys to the spade operators.

cards.title: Tenant service
cards.description: APIs allowing storage clients (data owners or onboarding entities) to publish datasets (CIDs), define replication requirements, set (and update) eligibility criteria on what SPs they want to work with.

cards.title: Validation service (health check)
cards.description: A set of processes to validate that various retrievability requirements set in contracts closed on the spade platform are being honored. This currently includes an instance of the ValidationBot service.

cards.title: Spade oracle service
cards.description: “Naive” oracle that tracks all active deals today on the network.

col_1.text: Spade consists of a collection of loosely-coupled services working together in harmony to create a holistic Filecoin storage marketplace
